availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John J. McLin (Caldwell County, Kentucky, shoemaker and clerk)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, shoemaker and clerk. Tennessee native. Married to Florinda J. Hockersmith McLin in Caldwell County, Kentucky, on January 15, 1838. Father of Elizabeth J. McLin, James R. McLin, Martha P. McLin, Catherine E. McLin, and Charles E. McLin. Shoemaker in Caldwell County in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in Caldwell County in 1850. Resident in Princeton in 1860. Clerk in Caldwell County in 1863.

ab.bibl:

Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File #12307.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Caldwell County Marriages, Film #000851644.
